column4: Hi - i need help - The problem is detailed here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1914789
The light comes on but the numpad controls my mouse
that file probably keeps getting written to by gnome
is there a way to stop that?
when I sudo that config file I get the following output: http://codepad.org/RQwsUoV8
sudo doesnt do what you think ... or you phrased that wrong ... what file
and stop trying to edit that file
are you mark on your system
you tried system -> preferences -> keyboard -> mouse keys ?
In Gnome I can't find Preferences: I did find system setting and I looked at the keyboard setting and there is no mouse key options
in gnome2 it has an option for what you need
There is no option for that: This is the available options: http://codepad.org/FXiJu3vO
well hope for the best i suppose
